title: Accessibility
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled Voiceover in the iOS Accessibility settings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the At Bat launcher icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the launcher icon will be successfully read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on one of the main navigation buttons
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the navigation button is properly read

Repeat for all navigation buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a favorite team icon on the main menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the button will be read as team name button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the Scoreboard and then then taps on the Audio icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the audio icon is properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the Scoreboard and then swipes through games on the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN then game details are properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the area where audio feeds are suppose to be on the audio controller page when no feeds available
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a no audio available message is read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the area where audio feeds are suppose to be on the audio controller page when feeds available
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the audio stream name is read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a news article header from the News section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the news articles heading is correctly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a news article from the News section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the news article is correctly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user is on a news article and then taps on the News button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the button is properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the game and feed are properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the Gameday and then taps on a highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Highlight's header is properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on Settings in Setting menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the setting is properly read

Repeat for each Setting

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the Teams menu and a taps on a team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the teams name is properly read

Repeat for each Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a team and taps on a game in the Game Schedule at the top
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN that day, month, and date are properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a team and and taps on any part of the Daily Matchup view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN that part of the daily matchup view is properly read

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a team and taps on a menu item located on the team's page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the menu item has it's name read correctly

Repeat for each Menu item

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on More > Teams > Team > Schedule > Calendar and we tap on each element
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN each element will read correctly
and each element will be accurate
and tapping on calendar cell will read month,date,team nickname, time of game and timezone.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on More > Teams > Team > Schedule > List and we tap on each element
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN each element will read correctly
and each element will be accurate
and if it's a game where pitchers are not shown then it will read TBD vs. TBD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on More > Teams > taps on a Team > Standings and we tap on any element
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN each element will read correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on More > Teams > Team > Roster and we tap on any Player
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN each Player will read correctly including their number and position (if available)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the news tab and opens up a news article with an embedded video and then double taps on the video
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video will begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on the elements on a webview (from More Menu)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the elements on the top and/or bottom of the webview are read correctly 

i.e. Back button, webview header, webpage go back button, webpage go forward button, reload webpage button, stop webpage from loading button
